me.joeycumines.javapromises.core

Interface Promise

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PromiseBase, PromiseRunnable

    public interface Promise
    A "Promise", the core concept of this class is based on the JavaScript ES6 promise implementation, with adaptions where necessary or where it made more sense.

    JavaScript and Java are very different languages, and therefore in practice this implementation is likely very naive.

    The primary goal that this library hopes to achieve is to improve developer QoL by improving flexibility "out of the box", with minimal additional complexity, when writing code or libraries that require asynchronous (Multi-Threaded) operations.

    Usage: Promises should implement this interface in full, in whatever manner suits the application. Implementations must support chaining, and must support anything that correctly implements this interface, as results from the return statement within then and except callbacks.

    A very important note: it is part of the contract of this interface that no method may block (unless specifically made to do so with a passed callback, for example), unless the method name ends in "sync", OR due to an INTERNAL lock in place to allow thread-safety.

    Read on to learn more, and good luck! You are probably going to need it.

    NOTE: Any changes to this should also be made to PromiseTyped, where relevant.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Promise always(java.util.function.Function callback)
      Specify a function to be run on ANY resolution (rejection OR fulfillment) of this promise.
      Promise except(java.util.function.Function callback)
      Specify a function to be run on failed resolution (rejection) of this promise.
      java.lang.Throwable exceptSync()
      Calling this method will block until the promise is resolved, returning the value if it resolved with REJECTED, otherwise returning null.
      PromiseState getState()
      Get the current state of the promise.
      java.lang.Object getValue()
      Get the resolved value of the promise.
      void sync()
      Calling this method will block the current thread until this is resolved.
      Promise then(java.util.function.Function callback)
      Specify a function to be run on successful resolution (fulfillment) of this promise.
      java.lang.Object thenSync()
      Calling this method will block until the promise is resolved, returning the value if it resolved with FULFILLED, otherwise returning null.
      <T> T thenSync(java.lang.Class<T> type)
      Functions the same as thenSync() but with an inbuilt type cast.

    • Method Detail

      • getState

        PromiseState getState()
        Get the current state of the promise.

        Checking this manually is not a preferred pattern.

        Returns:
        The state of the promise.

      • getValue

        java.lang.Object getValue()
                   throws PendingValueException
        Get the resolved value of the promise.

        Checking this manually is not a preferred pattern.

        Returns:
        The value resolved by this promise.
        Throws:
        PendingValueException - If this is called on a promise in a PENDING state.

      • then

        Promise then(java.util.function.Function callback)
        Specify a function to be run on successful resolution (fulfillment) of this promise.

        The callback Function will be called with the value resolved.

        This method generates a new promise, which will resolve with the value returned.

        If the callback provided itself returns a promise, the callback promises result AND status will be propagated to this promise (blocking this until the callback promise is itself resolved).

        Parameters:
        callback - Function\ The operation which will be performed if the promise resolves successfully.
        Returns:
        A promise which will resolve after the previous promise AND any inner operations.

      • except

        Promise except(java.util.function.Function callback)
        Specify a function to be run on failed resolution (rejection) of this promise.

        The callback Function will be called with the value resolved.

        This method generates a new promise, which will resolve with the value returned.

        If the callback provided itself returns a promise, the callback promises result AND status will be propagated to this promise (blocking this until the callback promise is itself resolved).

        Parameters:
        callback - Function\ The operation which will be performed if the promise fails to resolve successfully.
        Returns:
        A promise which will resolve after the previous promise AND any inner operations.

      • always

        Promise always(java.util.function.Function callback)
        Specify a function to be run on ANY resolution (rejection OR fulfillment) of this promise.

        The callback Function will be called with the value resolved.

        This method generates a new promise, which will resolve with the value returned.

        If the callback provided itself returns a promise, the callback promises result AND status will be propagated to this promise (blocking this until the callback promise is itself resolved).

        Parameters:
        callback - Function\ The operation which will be performed if the promise fails to resolve successfully.
        Returns:
        A promise which will resolve after the previous promise AND any inner operations.

      • sync

        void sync()
        Calling this method will block the current thread until this is resolved.

        NOTE: All responsibility for sane use of this method lies with the caller.

      • thenSync

        java.lang.Object thenSync()
        Calling this method will block until the promise is resolved, returning the value if it resolved with FULFILLED, otherwise returning null.
        Returns:
        The resolved value, or null if REJECTED.

      • thenSync

        <T> T thenSync(java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Functions the same as thenSync() but with an inbuilt type cast.
        Parameters:
        type - The type to cast to.

      • exceptSync

        java.lang.Throwable exceptSync()
        Calling this method will block until the promise is resolved, returning the value if it resolved with REJECTED, otherwise returning null.
        Returns:
        The resolved value, or null if FULFILLED.
